meanings.sent1: She was jigging happily at the party.
meanings.sent2: The children were jigging around the maypole.
meanings.sent3: The penguin started jigging on the ice, much to the amusement of the zoo visitors.
meanings.sent4: The leaves were jigging in the wind, creating a beautiful dance.
meanings.sent5: Her feet were jigging so fast, it was like they had a mind of their own.

meanings.definition: To move up and down quickly and lightly.
meanings.sent1: The fishing line was jigging as the fish tried to escape.
meanings.sent2: The rabbit was jigging through the field, avoiding the obstacles.
meanings.sent3: The butterfly was jigging from flower to flower in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The kite was jigging in the sky, caught in the gusty wind.
meanings.sent5: The heart monitor was jigging with each beat of the patient's heart.

meanings.sent1: The traditional Irish jigging was a crowd favorite.
meanings.sent2: The music invited everyone to join in the jigging.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's jigging across the tree branches was quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The colorful birds performed a beautiful jigging in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The jigging at the wedding reception brought smiles to all the guests.
